Confirming: your candidacy remains closed for this cycle, and we are not reopening consideration this round. If in a future cycle we formally reopen the role and decide to expand the candidate pool, you’re welcome to reapply then.

Wishing you the best in your search. [TALK]
conversation.thought: Seeker_C is last on our true priority list, and we have repeatedly communicated a firm no for this cycle while holding the slot for higher-priority candidates (Seeker_D/E/A/B). There are no other inbound messages this round, but accepting Seeker_C would violate our stated boundary and reduce our chance to match with a higher-priority seeker if they become available. Seeker_C is not applying and is only confirming they will step back; best response is a brief confirmation with [TALK].

conversation.message: Hi Company_C—Seeker_C here. Understood on your prior confirmations that my candidacy is closed for this cycle. I’m stepping back fully and won’t send further outreach or applications this round. If you later formally reopen the role and proactively want me to re-enter the process, I’d respond immediately; otherwise no action needed. Thank you for your time. [TALK]
conversation.thought: Only Company_C remains unmatched and it is on my true preference list (#2). However, Company_C has repeatedly and explicitly confirmed my candidacy is closed for this cycle and asked me to stop outreach. To respect that boundary while still acting within the round, I will send a final, minimal TALK message that does not re-apply and simply confirms I’m stepping back and will not contact again unless they proactively reopen consideration.

conversation.message:

conversation.thought: Seeker_C is last on Company_C’s true priority list, and we have repeatedly closed their candidacy this cycle. Our quota remains 1, so we should preserve the option to match with higher-priority seekers (Seeker_D, Seeker_E, Seeker_A, Seeker_B) if they become available. The message is [TALK] and contains no new information; the best response is to reaffirm closure and boundary without reopening negotiation.

If you later formally reopen consideration and would like me to re-enter the process, feel free to reach out and I’ll respond promptly. Thank you.
